oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Various excerpts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Four home-recorded excerpts of WSM (Nashville, TN) Grand Ole Opry broadcasts, featuring performances by Clyde Moody and Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours, with announcer George D. Hay. Circa mid- to late-1940s. Most likely from a non-Prince Albert segment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Clyde Moody; Ernest Tubb; Texas Troubadours
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: I Worship You (Clyde Moody) -- George D. Hay talks (incomplete) -- It's A Sin To Love You Like I Do (Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours) -- George D. Hay introduces Ernest Tubb -- You Only Want Me When You're Lonely (Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours) -- How Can I Be Sure (Ernest Tubb and his Texas Troubadours) (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Moody, Clyde, 1915-1989; Tubb, Ernest, 1914-1984; Texas Troubadours;
